string-array.name: Divisibility
string-array.item: The last digit is even (0, 2, 4, 6, or 8)
Sum the digits. The result must be divisible by 3
The last two digits form a number that is divisible by 4
The number should be divisible by 2 and 3
Forming an alternating sum of blocks of three from right to left gives a multiple of 7
The last three digits are divisible by 8
Sum the digits. The result must be divisible by 9.
Form the alternating sum of the digits. The result must be divisible by 11
It is divisible by 3 and by 4
Form the alternating sum of blocks of three from right to left.The result must be divisible by 13
It is divisible by 2 and by 7
It is divisible by 3 and by 5
Add the last two digits to four times the rest. The result must be divisible by 16
Subtract 5 times the last digit from the rest. The result must be divisibl by 17
It is divisible by 2 and by 9
Add twice the last digit to the rest.The result must be divisibl by 19
It is divisible by 10, and the tens digit is even.
It is divisible by 3 and by 7
It is divisible by 2 and by 11
Add 7 times the last digit to the rest.The result must be divisibl by 23
It is divisible by 3 and by 8
The number formed by the last two digits is divisible by 25

string-array.name: integers_description
string-array.item: Natural Numbers => Counting numbers are called natural numbers. Thus 1,2,3,4,5. . . are all natural numbers
Whole Numbers => All natural numbers together with zero(0) are called whole numbers. Thus 0,1,2,3,4,5. . . are all whole numbers
Integer Numbers => All natural numbers, 0 and negative of counting numbers are called integers
Positive Integer => 1,2,3,4,5, . . etc are called positive integer
Negative Integer => -1,-2,-3,-4,-5, . . etc are called Negative Integer Numbers:
Zero Integer => Zero ia an integer which is neither positive nor negative

string-array.name: addition_description
string-array.item: Closure property of addition => The sum of two integers is always integer
Commutative law of addition => If "a" and "b" are two integer, then a + b = b + a
Associative law of addition => If "a","b","c" are three integers, then (a+b)+c = a+(b+c)
Existence of additive identity => For any integer a, we have a+0 = 0+a. Zero is called additive for integers
Existence of additive inverse => For any integer a, we have a+(-a) = (-a)+a = 0. Additive inverse of a is(-a)

string-array.name: subtraction_description
string-array.item: Closure property of subtraction => The subtraction of any two integers is always integer
Commutative law of subtraction => If "a" and "b" are two integer, then a - b ≠ b - a. SO subtraction of integers is not commutative
Associative law of subtraction => If "a","b","c" are three integers, then (a-b)-c ≠ a-(b-c). SO subtraction of integers is not associative

string-array.name: multi_description
string-array.item: Multiplication rule 1 => To find the product of two integers with unlike signs, we find the product their values regardless of their signs and give a minus sign to the product
Multiplication rule 2 => To find the product of two integers with same signs, we find the product their values regardless of their signs and give a plus sign to the product
Closure property of multiplication => The product of two integers is always integer
Commutative law of multiplication => If "a" and "b" are two integer, then a x b = b x a
Associative law of multiplication => If "a","b","c" are three integers, then (axb)xc = ax(bxc)
Distribution law of multiplication => If "a","b","c" are three integers, then ax(b+c) = (axb)+(axc)
Existence of multiplicative identity => For any integer a, we have ax1 = ax1=a. "1" is called multiplicative identity for integers
Existence of multiplicative inverse => For any integer a, we have ax(1/a) = (1/a)xa = 1. multiplicative inverse of a is(1/a)
Property of zero => For every integer a, we have (ax0)=(0xa)=0.

string-array.name: division_description
string-array.item: Division rule 1 => For dividing one integer to the other,the two having unlike signs,we divide their values regardless of their signs and give a minus sign to the quotient
Division rule 2 => For dividing one integer to the other,the two having same signs,we divide their values regardless of their signs and give a plus sign to the quotient
Closure property of division => If "a" and "b" are two integer then (a÷b) is not necessarily an integer
Commutative law of division => If "a" and "b" are two integer, then a ÷ b ≠ b ÷ a
Associative law of division => If "a","b","c" are three integers, then (a÷b)÷c ≠ a÷(b÷c)
Distribution law of division => If "a","b","c" are three integers, then (a+b)÷c = (a÷c)+(b÷c) but a÷(b+c) ≠ (a÷b)+(a÷c)
Existence of divisibility identity => If "a" is am any integer and a≠0,then a÷1=a,"1" is called divisibility identity for integers
Existence of divisibility inverse => If "a" is am any integer and a≠0,then a÷a=1, divisibility inverse of a is(1/a)
Property of zero => If "a" is am any integer and a≠0,then 0÷a=0 but a÷0 is not meaningful

string-array.name: fraction_description
string-array.item: Decimal fraction => A fraction whose denominator is any of the numbers 10,100,1000 etc is called decimal fraction:
Vulgar fraction => A fraction whose denominator is a whole number,other than 10,100,1000 etc is called vulgar fraction:
Proper fraction => A fraction whose numerator is less than its denominator, is called proper fraction:
Improper fraction => A fraction whose numerator is more than or equal to its denominator, is called improper fraction:
Mixed fraction => A number which can be expressed as the sum of a natural number and a proper fraction, is called a mixed fraction:

string-array.name: frequency
string-array.item: Frequency of 2 is 4 means after 2^4 first digit of resultant number repeat itself like 2^5=32, first digit is 2. 2^6=64 first digit is 4. So we can see first digit repeat it self after its frequency

Frequency of 3 is 4 means after 3^4 first digit of resultant number repeat itself like 3^5=243, first digit is 3. 2^6=729 first digit is 9. So we can see first digit repeat it self after its frequency
Frequency of 4 is 2 means after 4^2 first digit of resultant number repeat itself like 4^3=64, first digit is 4. 4^4=256 first digit is 6. So we can see first digit repeat it self after its frequency
Frequency of 5 is 1 means first digit is always 5
Frequency of 6 is 1 means first digit is always 6
Frequency of 7 is 4 means after 7^4 first digit of resultant number repeat itself like 7^5=16807, first digit is 7. So we can see first digit repeat it self after its frequency
Frequency of 8 is 4 means after 8^5 first digit of resultant number repeat itself like 8^5=32768, first digit is 8. So we can see first digit repeat it self after its frequency
Frequency of 9 is 2 means after 9^2 first digit of resultant number repeat itself like 9^3=729, first digit is 9. So we can see first digit repeat it self after its frequency
